cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (160 km) SE of Fort Lauderdale, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest tonight, forecast to parallel the southeast Florida coast on Sunday, then turn north-northwest to north along the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or along the southeast coast of Florida (Boca Raton–Fort Lauderdale area) early Sunday, 02 Aug 2020

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC; Storm Surge Watch Jupiter Inlet to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Boca Raton, FL to Volusia/Flagler County Line, FL; Tropical Storm Warning north of Ocean Reef to south of Boca Raton, FL and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, then coastal Georgia and the Carolinas northward to New England through the 5-day period
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 kt) likely; brief hurricane-force gusts possible Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the Broward County coastline including Port Everglades at times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches could produce localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; short-period operational shutdowns due to lightning squalls.
